attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Assisted Dying.
attributes.background:
Today the House of Commons voted overwhelmingly against the Assisted Dying Bill. The votes were 330 against, 118 for.

I contend simply that this is grossly misrepresentative of public opinion and that we should be able to decide by plebiscite whether we ought to legalise euthanasia.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/106652

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
